ğŸ”§1. Install Vim

sudo apt update
sudo apt install vim

ğŸ§± 2. Install Plugin Manager (vim-plug)

curl -fLo ~/.vim/autoload/plug.vim --create-dirs \
   https://raw.githubusercontent.com/junegunn/vim-plug/master/plug.vim

ğŸ—‚ï¸ 3. Configure ~/.vimrc

Open or create your Vim configuration file:

vim ~/.vimrc

Paste the following configuration:

" ----------------------------
" VS Code-like Vim Configuration
" ----------------------------

call plug#begin('~/.vim/plugged')

" File explorer with icons
Plug 'preservim/nerdtree'
Plug 'ryanoasis/vim-devicons'

" Enhanced status line
Plug 'vim-airline/vim-airline'
Plug 'vim-airline/vim-airline-themes'

" Syntax highlighting for many languages
Plug 'sheerun/vim-polyglot'

" Git integration
Plug 'tpope/vim-fugitive'

" Linting and diagnostics
Plug 'dense-analysis/ale'

" Auto code formatting
Plug 'Chiel92/vim-autoformat'

" Color scheme
Plug 'morhetz/gruvbox'

call plug#end()

" === General Settings ===
syntax on
set number
set relativenumber
set tabstop=4
set shiftwidth=4
set expandtab
set smartindent
set autoindent
set background=dark
colorscheme gruvbox

" === Status Line ===
let g:airline_theme='gruvbox'
let g:airline_powerline_fonts=1

" === NERDTree Shortcut ===
nnoremap <C-n> :NERDTreeToggle<CR>

" === Format on Save ===
autocmd BufWritePre * :Autoformat

" === Git Shortcut ===
nnoremap <leader>gs :G<CR>

" === Mouse Support ===
set mouse=a

" === Enable Icons ===
set encoding=utf-8
let g:WebDevIconsUnicodeDecorateFileNodes = 1
let g:NERDTreeShowHidden=1

ğŸ”Œ 4. Install Vim Plugins

Install external formatters based on the languages you use:

ğŸ¨ 6. Enable Icons with Nerd Fonts (Optional but Recommended)

Install Nerd Fonts for proper icon rendering. Hereâ€™s an example using JetBrainsMono:

mkdir -p ~/.local/share/fonts
cd ~/.local/share/fonts

Then, in your terminal settings, set the font to JetBrainsMono Nerd Font.
